CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this stream chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Sector Beta relative to District Alpha?
SRP.A: Sector Beta is {below} District Alpha in the vertical direction.

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing District Alpha relative to Sector Beta?
SRP.A: District Alpha is {above} Sector Beta in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total life expectancy?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {District Alpha}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total life expectancy?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Sector Beta}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is District Alpha's minimum Life Expectancy in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: District Alpha's minimum Life Expectancy is in {2015}.

EVJ.Q: Which year is Sector Beta's maximum Life Expectancy in the streamgraph?
EVJ.A: Sector Beta's maximum Life Expectancy is in {2022}.

NC.Q: Between 2015 and 2016, was the average total Life Expectancy higher or lower than between 2013 and 2019?
NC.A: The average total life expectancy between 2015 and 2016 was {higher} than between 2013 and 2019.

NC.Q: Between 2018 and 2020, did the total Life Expectancy experience a larger or smaller change than between 2017 and 2022?
NC.A: The change in total life expectancy between 2018 and 2020 was {larger} than between 2017 and 2022.

NC.Q: Was the total Life Expectancy in 2016 higher or lower than in 2022?
NC.A: The total life expectancy in 2016 was {lower} than in 2022.

NC.Q: Was the total Life Expectancy in 2013 higher or lower than in 2019?
NC.A: The total life expectancy in 2013 was {higher} than in 2019.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, which one held the dominant position for the longest period of time?
MSR.A: {Sector Beta} held the dominant position for the longest period of time.

MSR.Q: In this streamgraph, in which year did Sector Beta and District Alpha first exchange dominant positions?
MSR.A: Sector Beta and District Alpha first exchanged leading positions in {2019}.
